content: Write a sonnet about the mysteries of the ocean in the style of Shakespeare.

In deepest seas where sunlight dareth not to stray,

Lie secrets old, in briny deeps arrayed;

A world unknown, where creatures strange doth play,

Beyond the reach of human hand or blade.

The ocean's heart, a mystery so profound,

Doth hold within its depths both joy and woe;

Its tides and currents, ebb and flow around,

A dance of nature, ever e'er so slow.

Yet, in its bosom, treasures lie untold,

From pearls of luster to gold so rare;

And ancient wrecks, where stories yet unfold,

Of sailors past, now sleeping in despair.

So let us marvel at the ocean's might,

A realm of wonder, hidden from our sight.
